page.title: 08TILESHEDS SIGNALBOX,E.BOLDON
page.content: Bordering the southwest corner of the Whiteleas Estate is the main Sunderland - Newcastle railway line. Tileshed Lane crossing is controlled by{Tilesheds Signal Box}and Boldon level crossing is automatically controlled by the trains. The signal box at Tilesheds,which is owned by British Rail controls 2000 yards of track and is manned 24 hours a day by signalmen who work 8 hour shifts. The signals on the line are operated by hand levers. However within the next 10 years, British Rail say the box will be demolished and run by computer from elsewhere. On average, 7 local trains travel along the line every hour. The 625 London Express passes twice daily. Opposite the signal box stand 6{ {railway cottages,}built 100 years ago.
